intro: Ouratea warneckei, commonly known as the Brazilian holly or the yellow holly, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ochnaceae. It is native to the Atlantic rainforests of Brazil, where it thrives in humid, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its glossy, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in the spring. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, winged seeds. Ouratea warneckei is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and unique floral display.
